myopenmath.statement:
Arthur Dent suspects that there is a difference in the variation in the number of daily customers at two restaurants, the Big Bang Burger Bar and Milliways. Both distributions are normal, and the populations are independent. Use α = 0.01. A sample of 23 randomly selected days from Big Bang Burger Bar found a standard deviation of 68.0589 customers. A sample of 19 randomly selected days from Milliways found a standard deviation of 38.9189. Test to see if there is a difference in the variance in the number of daily customers at the Big Bang Burger Bar compared to Milliways.
What are the correct hypotheses? Note this may view better in full screen mode. Select the correct symbols in the order they appear in the problem.
{H}_{0}:

Based on the hypotheses, compute the following:
Round answers to at least 4 decimal places.
The test statistic is =
The p-value is =
The decision is to
Reject the null hypothesis
Fail to reject the null hypothesis
Reject the claim
Accept the alternative hypothesis
.
The correct summary would be:
There is not enough evidence to support the claim
There is not enough evidence to reject the claim
There is enough evidence to support the claim
There is enough evidence to reject the claim
that the variance in the number of daily customers at the Big Bang Burger Bar compared to Milliways.

ul.li: C: There is enough evidence to support the claim
